Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of CMV pp65 mRNA-Loaded Dendritic Cell Vaccination

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised controlled trial included four CMV-seronegative healthy volunteers and three allogeneic HSCT recipients

Participants.evidence: four CMV-seronegative healthy volunteers and three allogeneic HSCT recipients at Antwerp University Hospital

Intervention.evidence: Participants received four weekly intradermal DC vaccines prepared from a single leukapheresis

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the safety, feasibility, and immunogenicity of CMV pp65 mRNA-loaded autologous monocyte-derived dendritic cells (DC) as a vaccine

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the induction of CMV-specific T-cell responses, assessed one month post-vaccination

Number_Randomised.evidence: four CMV-seronegative healthy volunteers and three allogeneic HSCT recipients

Result_Outcome.evidence: Three of four healthy volunteers showed de novo CMV-specific T-cell responses without serious adverse events

Harms.evidence: Adverse events included transient local redness and mild swelling at the injection site, with no serious events reported in healthy subjects

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided
